Dialogue.NPCText:
Before you stands an old man, his eyes covered by an embroidered strip of indigo silk. His flowing shroud and golden robe glimmer in the desert sun. He leans on a bone-white crook carved with ancient runes.

He turns, as if seeing you with other senses.

“The shifting winds whisper new names… Another seeker approaches, guided by fate or folly. I am Aqil, once scribe of Qasaria’s Sun Temple—now, a blind watcher of what stirs beneath the sands.
Speak, and perhaps the Ancients will let me answer. Or perhaps, as ever, you will find only riddles.”

Option.text: I seek wisdom, Seer.
Tell me of yourself, Aqil.
Do your visions show Lord British’s fate?
What do you know of the Ancients?
Can you foretell Qasaria’s future?
I heard you speak of a hidden relic...
I wish to know more about your past.
Farewell, Seer.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aqil smiles, lines etched deep by years of desert wind.
“In youth, I was a scribe of the Sun Temple, chronicler to the Council of Jewels—before sight was stolen by a shadow in the crypts.
Safiya al-Sapphire once trusted my numbers; Yasmin al-Topaz envied my memory; even Sultan Rafiq sometimes sought my counsel.
Now, I listen to voices others do not hear, and see only what the Ancients permit. Beware, for prophecy is a cruel mirror; it shows not comfort, but only necessity.”

Option.text: You know the Council well. Are they in danger?
How did you lose your sight?
What wisdom can you share?
Let us speak of something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Each gem on the council's circlet desires to outshine the others. Rafiq broods, Safiya schemes, Karim whispers, Yasmin hungers for forbidden truths, and Omar delights in chaos.
Minax’s shadow lies on every ambition. Trust not the coin alone—nor the promise of swords. Only those who listen to the desert’s silence will hear the warning before it comes.”

Option.text: Do your visions warn of Minax?
What prophecy do you offer for me?
Let us change the subject.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aqil’s hand brushes his silk blindfold.
“Some say knowledge is power. In the crypts below Qasaria, I sought the glyphs of the Ancients—alone. Shadows gathered, and I saw what mortals should not.
The darkness took my sight, but left me new eyes—visions unbidden, sometimes unwanted. It is a fair trade, perhaps, for wisdom without comfort.”

Option.text: What did you see?
Thank you for sharing, Aqil.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“You seek wisdom? The sand remembers what stone forgets.
All things turn in cycles—desert, city, even the Gem of Immortality. Beware those who promise the end of suffering, for they only trade one shadow for another.”

Option.text: Do you speak of Minax?
What prophecy have you for me?
Tell me of the Ancients.
Enough riddles, I have other questions.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“The Ancients ruled when the world was young, when the Gem of Immortality was whole.
Their magic still slumbers beneath our feet, waiting for a true seeker to wake it—yet beware, for not all relics wish to be found.
If you seek their power, bring both wisdom and humility—or the sand will reclaim your bones.”

Option.text: Is there truly a relic hidden below Qasaria?
Does Minax seek the Ancients’ magic?
I wish to know more of Qasaria.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aqil tilts his head, listening to distant winds.
“Lord British walks the crossroads between life and legend. I see him among stars, and in the darkest mirror of Minax’s dreams.
His return is possible—but not certain. For now, Britannia must survive without its old sun. Some will rise in his absence, others will fall.
Seek the shard that holds his memory. In it, fate’s door may open.”

Option.text: Where is this shard?
Do others seek it too?
Thank you, Seer.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Qasaria shines now, gold upon sand, but pride blinds as surely as silk.
If the Council does not unite, Minax’s shadow will feast upon our splendor.
If you would aid Qasaria, seek out what sleeps beneath the Bazaar. The Ancients’ heart may yet save—or doom—us all.”

Option.text: You mean a relic?
Tell me more of the Council’s divisions.
Your words trouble me, Seer. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aqil’s fingers grip his crook.
“Minax weaves a net of greed and fear. She bargains with Safiya, tempts Omar with violence, and whispers secrets to Karim.
Only Yasmin resists, guarding the old ways—but her power wanes. If you cross Minax’s path, do not trust the obvious foe. The knife is always hidden in the second hand.”

Option.text: If I aid Yasmin, could I stop Minax?
What of Safiya’s bargains?
I wish to serve Qasaria’s true cause.
Let us speak of other things.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aqil’s voice drops, almost a whisper.
“The Ancients left tokens beneath Qasaria—one is close to waking. I have seen it: a Sand-Shard of Memory, veiled in dream, lost in the Bazaar’s catacombs.
Many seek it: Minax’s agents, the Council’s spies, even Yasmin’s own apprentices. If you wish to test your fate, find this shard and bring it to the Sun Temple.
Beware—shadows gather where relics lie. Take this scroll; it will mark the true path, but only if you walk with purpose.”

Option.text: I will seek the Sand-Shard of Memory.
What dangers await below the Bazaar?
What if I choose not to meddle with fate?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aqil lifts his crook, tracing a circle in the air.
“So fate turns. Take the scroll—its ink is mixed with ancient dust; follow where it guides, and beware Minax’s laughter in the dark.
Return to the Sun Temple when you hold the Sand-Shard. The path ahead may split—will you serve the Council, Yasmin, or a greater cause? Destiny is a web: choose your strand with care.”

Option.text: Thank you, Seer. I will not fail.
Can I aid Yasmin further?
If I wished to betray the Council...?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Catacombs under Qasaria hold more than bones: smugglers, undead, whispers that twist the mind.
Watch for Zahid’s assassins—Shadowmaster of the Undermarket would claim the shard for his own.
If the shadows touch you, return to the surface—lest your soul be lost beneath the sand.”

Option.text: I am prepared. Give me the quest scroll.
Perhaps I am not ready.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Yasmin al-Topaz stands between Minax and Qasaria’s ruin. If you trust her, seek her counsel with the shard. Yet remember, even Yasmin is not free from the Ancients’ games.
She may ask you to sacrifice what you most value, for wisdom always demands a price.”

Option.text: I will seek her counsel.
I must consider my path carefully.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aqil’s lips curl in a thin smile.
“Fate is patient; betrayal breeds consequences. Deliver the shard to Safiya or Zahid, and you may profit—for a season. But every bargain with shadow is a debt that must be paid.”

Option.text: Thank you for your honesty.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aqil leans slightly on his crook, the desert wind curling his robe like flame.
“Few ask about the road that made me. Fewer still walk it beside me.
Sit if you have time. Let me remember what the sands have buried.”

Option.text: Tell me of your youth in Qasaria.
How did you become blind?
Were you ever in love, Seer?
What was your role in the Council’s archives?
Another time, perhaps.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I was born beneath the dome of the Amber Gate, third son of a spice merchant. My mind wandered faster than my father’s camels.
The High Priestess Samira saw my hunger for knowledge and took me as her pupil. I copied texts until my fingers bled ink, and learned to listen to the wind between words.”

Option.text: You studied under Samira? What was she like?
That sounds like a lonely path.
Let’s return to your present.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aqil smiles faintly.
“Samira was sharp as desert glass, and twice as dangerous. She taught that truth is sacred—but never safe.
Even now, she guards the Obelisk of Eternity. When I speak of prophecy, I wonder if she hears, and nods... or weeps.”

Option.text: She must have cared for you deeply.
What does the Obelisk truly do?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“It was. But in loneliness I heard the deeper voices.
Scrolls became my siblings. The glyphs of the Ancients—my language. And when I spoke them aloud... the wind would change.
I think I was always meant to be a listener. Even before I lost my eyes.”

Option.text: What did you hear in those scrolls?
You are more than a listener, Seer.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“It was beneath the Bazaar, far below where light dies. I found a sealed reliquary—a relic not meant to be opened.
When I read its sigils, I saw the moment of my death a thousand times over. My eyes could not contain the truth. They burned… and something else looked back at me.
Yet I lived. And now I see further than I ever did.”

Option.text: Did it speak to you?
Was it a trap set by Minax?
That explains your warnings.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aqil’s voice drops low.
“It whispered of the Shardborne, of a world that once was whole. I saw Lord British cast into a prism of dreams… and Minax standing alone, touching the Gem with bloody hands.
The relic still whispers. Perhaps it waits for you.”

Option.text: Where is the relic now?
That vision chills me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aqil is quiet for a time.
“Yes. Her name was Leilani—a dancer of the southern caravans. Her laughter could stop storms.
I asked her to stay. She said prophets are poor lovers.
I do not blame her.”

Option.text: She may yet return to you.
Option.action: SendMessage:You say it gently, and he smiles faintly.

Option.text: That must have broken your heart.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“No heart breaks all at once. It withers, like a map in flame.
But even sorrow teaches. From her, I learned beauty fades—but memory endures.
And now, I dance only with fate.”

Option.text: Your story humbles me.
Thank you for sharing that.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Before I became ‘the Seer,’ I was known as Aqil of the Inkstone—a chief archivist.
I mapped the genealogy of Qasaria’s founders, translated runes from the Western Expanse, even built the first sand-clock tower near the Sun Temple.
But scholars are rarely remembered unless they go mad... or blind.”

Option.text: You built the sand-clock tower?
You deserve more recognition.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I did. Its gears came from Vesper, the sand from the Red Dunes, and the bell chimes at each solar hour.
There is a hidden compartment beneath the foundation—where I left a sealed scroll.
One day, someone clever might find it.”

Option.text: Should I look for it?
Option.action: SendMessage:A hidden relic beneath the sand-clock? Interesting...

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aqil chuckles.
“Perhaps she did. She once told me: ‘Your mind is a desert storm—brilliant, but always elsewhere.’
She taught me to pause. To breathe. That, too, is prophecy.”

Option.text: You speak of her with great warmth.
